required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Mass Balance Study to Investigate the Absorption, Metabolism, and Excretion of [14C]Sulfatinib
clinical_study.official_title: Single-center, Open and Single-dose Clinical Trial to Explore the Mass Balance of Oral Suspension of 300 mg /100 μCi [14C] Sulfatinib in Chinese Adult Male Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-center, open label and single-dose clinical trail, to explore the body mass balance and identify the major metabolites in Chinese adult male healthy volunteers after a single oral dose of [14C]Sulfatinib, to obtain the pharmacokinetic parameters of plasma and observe the safety of healthy volunteers after a single oral dose of [14C]Sulfatinib.

detailed_description.textblock: In order to determine the optimal time point for sample collection, this study will be divided into two stages: the first stage, two volunteers will be enrolled, the volunteers should stop collecting the corresponding samples by the investigators based on radioactive test results, safety results combined with the actual comprehensive situation. And in the second stage sample collection time for another four volunteers will be determined and adjusted according to the results of the first stage.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This is single centre, open label, single dose study

primary_outcome.measure: To investigate the area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC) from 0 to the time of the last measurable concentration (AUCt) of total radioactivity of [14C] Sulfatinib
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from the 0 hour to 216 hours
primary_outcome.description: The area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC) from 0 to the time of the last measurable concentration.

secondary_outcome.measure: To investigate the Maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax) of total radioactivity of [14C] Sulfatinib
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from the 0 hour to 216 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum observed concentration, occurring at Tmax.

secondary_outcome.measure: To investigate the time to Cmax (peak time, Tmax) of total radioactivity of [14C] Sulfatinib
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from the 0 hour to 216 hours
secondary_outcome.description: The time at which maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) is observed.

secondary_outcome.measure: To investigate Half-life (t1/2) of total radioactivity of [14C] Sulfatinib
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from the 0 hour to 216 hours
secondary_outcome.description: The time at which Half-life (t1/2) is observed.

secondary_outcome.measure: To obtain mass balance data after a single oral dose of [14C] Sulfatinib
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured on the Day1 to Day15
secondary_outcome.description: Quantitative analysis of total radioactivity in the excretion of Sulfatinib

secondary_outcome.measure: To observe the safety of healthy volunteers after a single oral dose of [14C]Sulfatinib.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from the date signed ICF to within 15 days after the single dose

arm_group.description: This is a single center and single dose in 6 volunteers. Subject would take a suspension containing 300 mg of Sulfatinib (containing about 100 μCi of radioactivity) within 1 hour after standard breakfast.

intervention.other_name: 300 mg /100 μCi [14C] Sulfatinib, Sulfatinib, HMPL-012, Surufatinib

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Provision of written Informed Consent Form (ICF)
2. Age of 18-50 (inclusive)；
3. Body weight over 50 kg and body mass index (BMI) between 19-26 kg / m2 (inclusive)；
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Laboratory tests (blood tests, blood biochemical tests [fasting], coagulation tests, thyroid function tests, urinalysis, fecal occult blood) judged as clinically significant abnormal by investigators；
2. Clinically significant abnormal ECG at screening and before screening；
3. Hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg), e antigen (HBeAg) or hepatitis C antibody (HCV Ab) test positive；
4. Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) antibody positive；
5. Treponema pallidum antibody positive.
